alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 23 at 2:25AM MST until March 23 at 2:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arizona... Verde River above Clarkdale affecting Yavapai County. For the Verde River near Clarkdale...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Verde River above Clarkdale. * WHEN...Until this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, high flow could lead to bank erosion and water ponding in backwater catch basins. At 12.0 feet, nuisance flooding of property along riverbanks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:00 AM MST Thursday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:00 AM MST Thursday was 14.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 13.2 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage later this morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety. && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 am MST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Verde River Clarkdale 12.0 12.9 Thu 2 am MST 6.0 3.7 3.0 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at: http://ahps2.wrh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=fgz The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 200 PM MST.
